dt: {bc}a low-lying meadow by the side of a river

et: early Scots {it}hawgh, hauch,{/it} going back to {it}halch, halech{/it} (in Latin documents), going back to Old English {it}healh, halch{/it} "corner, recess," of uncertain origin

The Old English word is traditionally taken to be related to {it}holh{/it} "cavity, hole" (see {et_link|hollow:2|hollow:2}), but if {it}holh{/it} continues {it}*hulh-a-{/it} and {it}healh{/it} {it}*halh-a-{/it} there is no certain relationship.
shortdef: a low-lying meadow by the side of a river
